alert.note: Alert for Giles; Lawrence; Lewis; Marshall; Maury (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 3:03PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lewis, northwestern Marshall, northeastern Lawrence, Maury and northern Giles Counties through 345 PM CDT... At 303 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Spring Hill to near Lawrenceburg. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Columbia, Lawrenceburg, Spring Hill, Mount Pleasant, Summertown, Ethridge, Lynnville, Henryville, Culleoka, Hampshire, Williamsport and I-65 East Of Columbia. This includes Interstate 65 between mile markers 27 and 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
